docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Nicholas Murray Butler, President of Columbia University, returned yesterday on the White Star liner Olympic from his annual vacation in Europe, accompanied by Mrs. Butler and their daughter. In a statement he had prepared for THE NEW YORK TIMES regarding conditions as he found them in England and on the Continent Dr. Butler said:

headline.main: BUTLER SEES HOPE FOR WORLD PEACE; Says Security of France and Germany Will Remove Cause of Future Warfare. MARKED ADVANCE IN EUROPE Columbia President, Back From Trip Abroad, Tells of Conditions as He Found Them.

docs.abstract: Views of Dr N M Butler, int
docs.snippet: Dr. Nicholas Murray Butler, President of Columbia University, returned yesterday on the White Star liner Olympic from his annual vacation in Europe, accompanied by Mrs. Butler and their daughter. In a statement he had prepared for THE NEW YORK TIMES...

docs.lead_paragraph: SWAMPSCOTT, Mass., July 31. -- President Coolidge, following a conference on finances and taxation with Representative Martin M. Madden. Chairman of the House Appropriations Committee, declined today to commit himself to the suggestions advanced by Mr. Madden that the combined income taxes should be reduced to 20 per cent.

headline.main: MADDEN WOULD CUT INCOME TAX IN TWO; Favors 15 Per Cent. Maximum Surtax and Would Abolish Estate and Gift Levies.
